title._content: [Portrait of Baby Dodds, Marty Marsala, Bunty Pendelton, and Albert Nicholas, Riverboat on the Hudson, N.Y., ca. July 1947] (LOC)

description._content: Gottlieb, William P., 1917-, photographer. [Portrait of Baby Dodds, Marty Marsala, Bunty Pendelton, and Albert Nicholas, Riverboat on the Hudson, N.Y., ca. July 1947] 1 negative : b&w ; 2 1/4 x 2 1/4 in. Caption from Down Beat: [from article] Gimmick of the month was Riverboat Jazz on the Hudson . . . . Shown most prominently below the roof of life-belts are the gentlemen Dodds, Marsala and Nicholas. James P., Pops Foster and the rest of this almost inseparable group fell overboard before the shutter snapped. Notes: Gottlieb Collection Assignment No. 034 Purchase William P. Gottlieb Forms part of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (Library of Congress). In: The Record Changer, v. 6, no. 5 (July 47, 1947), p. 6. Subjects: Dodds, Baby, 1894-1959 Marsala, Marty Pendelton, Bunty Nicholas, Albert, 1900 Jazz musicians--1940-1950. Trumpet players--1940-1950. Riverboat on the Hudson Format: Portrait photographs--1940-1950. Group portraits--1940-1950. Film negatives--1940-1950. Rights Info: Mr. Gottlieb has dedicated these works to the public domain, but rights of privacy and publicity may apply. lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-copyrig... Repository: (negative) Library of Congress, Prints & Photographs Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Part Of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (DLC) 99-401005 General information about the Gottlieb Collection is available at lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-home.html Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.music/gottlieb.14851 Call Number: LC-GLB23- 1485
